intro: Periclymenum, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. These plants are characterized by their heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink. They are typically found in woodland areas and thrive in moist, shaded environments. Periclymenum species are perennial herbs that produce seed pods containing several seeds. The genus includes several species, such as Periclymenum vulgare, which is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
